channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9832] Add MR support for Visibility labels
item.description: MR needs to support adding the visibility labels through TableOutputFormat and HfileOutPutformat.
item.summary: Add MR support for Visibility labels

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch for supporting Visibility labels in MR. The last two testcases seems to be an unwanted white space change. Will remove it during the next iteration.
Pls review and provide your comments.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12610620/HBASE-9832.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 12 new or modified tests.

-1 hadoop1.0. The patch failed to compile against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7649//console

This message is automatically generated.

Can you put the patch on review board ?

For HFileOutputFormat, How is the new configureIncrementalLoad() different from the existing one, apart from the addition of reducerClass parameter ?
Ping ramkrishna.s.vasudevan or Anoop Sam John, planning to branch 0.98 on 12/1.
Submitting for hadoopQA.
All test cases are passing.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12616035/HBASE-9832_1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 5 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 2 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 2 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-thrift.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8015//console

This message is automatically generated.

+  public static void configureIncrementalLoad(Job job, HTable table, Class reducerClass)

The above method is similar to:


  public static void configureIncrementalLoad(Job job, HTable table)

Can the common code be extracted ?

TextSortReducerWithVisibility is marked @InterfaceStability.Evolving while TsvImportMapperForVisibility is declared @InterfaceStability.Stable
What's the rationale ?

TsvImporterTextMapperForVisibility and TsvImportMapperForVisibilityWithHFileFormat don't have audience annotation.

Rather than taking the visibility expression in the file as attributes, can we add a new column for visibility? Like RK column and TS column. Fix a name for the column and that data will be used as ColumnVisibility.
When it is TableOutputFormat (Map alone job) set this visibility to Put CellVisibility.
When it is HFileOutputFormat, use the expression and convert to tag and set in every KV.
So we will add everything like ACLs also as new columns only and then use them in the core code itself?

Supporting with a column for Visibility, it will be one visibility expr/string for that entire row. Will that be fine? May be I wil prepare a patch with column for visibility and later decide which can go in?

Supporting with a column for Visibility, it will be one visibility expr/string for that entire row.

Yes. Just like whe pass a CellVisibility with one Put
Patch that uses cell visibility as a column.

This message is automatically generated.
Can u put patch on rb?
https://reviews.apache.org/r/15928/

ImportTSV#createTable()


for (String aColumn : columns) {

      if (TsvParser.ROWKEY_COLUMN_SPEC.equals(aColumn)

          || TsvParser.TIMESTAMPKEY_COLUMN_SPEC.equals(aColumn)) continue;

Pls add the check for CELL_VISIBILITY_COLUMN_SPEC also so that we wont create a cf named CELL_VISIBILITY_COLUMN_SPEC?
Latest patch.
